snippet: Privacy watchdogs from European Union countries expressed doubts that a new data-transfer pact with the United States could protect personal information.
abstract: Europe’s national privacy agencies demand more information on whether EU-US Privacy Shield data transfer agreement will adequately protect personal information; pact covers trans-Atlantic transmission of personal data; agencies are primarily concerned about how much access American intelligence agencies will have.
lead_paragraph: Privacy watchdogs from European Union countries expressed doubts that a new data-transfer pact with the United States could protect personal information.

headline.main: European Privacy Regulators Want Details on ‘Safe Harbor’ Data Deal
headline.print_headline: European Privacy Agencies Seek Details on Data Transfer Deal With U.S.
